upcycles.environmentalImpact: Plastic Bottles are estimated to take around 450 years to break down
upcycles.supplies: Plastic bottle, small dog treats or kibble
upcycles.instructions: Insert dog treats or kibble into empty plastic bottle. OPTION: Cut holes and hang on pole for a further challenge for your dog!

upcycles.environmentalImpact: Plastic grocery bags are estimated to take more than 500 years to break down
upcycles.instructions: Use grocery bag as a trash bag liner. Great for offices and bedrooms!

upcycles.environmentalImpact: Plastic grocery bags are estimated to take more than 500 years to break down
upcycles.instructions: Use grocery bag to store various items, such as other grocery bags for upcycling later.

upcycles.environmentalImpact: Plastic grocery bags are estimated to take more than 500 years to break down
upcycles.supplies: Plastic grocery bag, paper grocery bag
upcycles.instructions: Line the inside of the paper grocery bag with the plastic grocery bag. Make sure there are no holes in the plastic grocery bag. Flatten and store next to bed, or in car in case you feel sick!

upcycles.environmentalImpact: Plastic grocery bags are estimated to take more than 500 years to break down
upcycles.supplies: plastic grocery bag, pair of shoes, suitcase/backpack
upcycles.instructions: Put shoes inside grocery bag in order to prevent possible dirt from shoes from getting on clothes inside luggage.

upcycles.environmentalImpact: Plastic grocery bags are estimated to take more than 500 years to break down
upcycles.instructions: Use a saved grocery bag to pick up waste when walking your dog, or double up on bags and use when cleaning out litter-box.

upcycles.environmentalImpact: Plastic grocery bags are estimated to take more than 500 years to break down
upcycles.instructions: Flatten bag on a flat surface, fold in half vertically (hot-dog style) twice, then cut horizontally 1-inch strips. Connect each plastic strip loops by knotting the ends together, and roll into a ball for future use.

upcycles.environmentalImpact: Plastic prescription bottles are estimated to take between 20 and 30 years to break down
upcycles.supplies: Prescription bottle, razor blade, fishing tackle, stormproof matches, dryer lint, bandaids
upcycles.instructions: Add items into empty prescription bottle and store in car or while camping.

upcycles.environmentalImpact: Thicker plastics are estimated to take 500-1000 years to break down in the environment
upcycles.supplies: Plastic grocery bags, empty clorox wipes container
upcycles.instructions: roll grocery bags together (like paper towels) and place in container, pulling out one of the ends to stick out the top of the container.

upcycles.environmentalImpact: CDs and DVDs are estimated to take 10-30 years to break down
upcycles.supplies: CDs or DVDs, tray, hot glue gun, resin, strong scissors
upcycles.instructions: Cut CDs/DVDs in half. Gently pry apart the two layers with your fingers, then cut the halves into small pieces. Hot glue pieces down metallic side up onto the tray, then prepare and pour resin in tray. Cover and let sit. OPTION: Use heat gun to get rid of bubbles after 20 minutes

upcycles.supplies: Twist ties and your bag of choice
upcycles.instructions: Simply twist tie around the end of the bag.
Use twist ties to wrap, hold together, and organize various wires.

upcycles.supplies: Old tin cakepan and your favorite small succulent plants
upcycles.instructions: Fill cake pan with soil and plant succulents inside.
